messages.messageBody:
~~But how will they ever get into college!! :)

I dont understand what youre asking???~~

It was a joke. People will ask that a lot as your kids get older...be
prepared.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Re: today so far
messages.msgSnippet: My kids can dress themselves (well my 14 month old can do a shirt lol) but some days they choose not to. Hell- I say we wear pjs EVERYDAY. You will find me at
messages.messageBody:
My kids can dress themselves (well my 14 month old can do a shirt
lol) but some days they choose not to.

Hell- I say we wear pjs EVERYDAY. You will find me at walmart,
grocery shopping at midnight in my pjs every week. I love it! LOL

today so far
Posted by: "kristenhendricks55" kristenhendricks55@... kristenhendricks55
Tue Jan 9, 2007 9:41 am (PST)
I just wanted to tell everyone thanks for all the advice.

I decided to stop reading and start doing and just see how a day would
do without using the word "no" as was being discussed.

We had fettucine alfredo for breakfast and are now eating snickers and
carrots for lunch (nice combo, eh?)lol

Both my girls are eating in their underwear.

Just a week ago I would have said "no, we're having this for
breakfast" or "its time to get dressed". Thanks for helping me think
outside the box.

Everyone is happy today (so far) with no tantrums.

And despite the snickers and carrots, lol, so far- no casualties :)



Cocking A Snook
A Blog for Thinking Parents
http://cockingasnook.wordpress.com/

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] today so far
messages.msgSnippet: ... Way cool!  I often have salads or fruit smoothies with greens added (called green smoothies ) for breakfast.  Food is food.  It s only our culture that
messages.messageBody:
kristenhendricks55 wrote:

> We had fettucine alfredo for breakfast and are now eating snickers and
> carrots for lunch (nice combo, eh?)lol

Way cool! I often have salads or fruit smoothies with greens added
(called "green smoothies") for breakfast. Food is food. It's only our
culture that has categorized it according to meal times :)

Ariannah in Nova Scotia
--
"May we all have a vision now and then
Of a world where every neighbour is a friend"
Abba "Happy New Year" 1980
Personal Blog: http://ec.lecti.ca

messages.subject: today so far
messages.msgSnippet: I just wanted to tell everyone thanks for all the advice. I decided to stop reading and start doing and just see how a day would do without using the word no
messages.messageBody:
I just wanted to tell everyone thanks for all the advice.

I decided to stop reading and start doing and just see how a day would
do without using the word "no" as was being discussed.

We had fettucine alfredo for breakfast and are now eating snickers and
carrots for lunch (nice combo, eh?)lol

Both my girls are eating in their underwear.


Just a week ago I would have said "no, we're having this for
breakfast" or "its time to get dressed". Thanks for helping me think
outside the box.

Everyone is happy today (so far) with no tantrums.

And despite the snickers and carrots, lol, so far- no casualties :)
